result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended. 

AODA. 

DNA sample.

Case called:  8:47 AM
Clerk: Brenda
Includes 15CF197, 15CF457, 15CM677, 16CF186, 16CF489, 16CF941, 17CF1044, 17CF1066, 18CF1174, 18CM2096 and 17TR4446;
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in custody with Atty Joseph Kaupie;
Deft stipulates to this branch handling the plea for all of these cases;
18CF1174 - PRELIM --- Waiver of  Prelim filed.  Court ques. Deft re: Waiver.   Court finds Waiver freely & vol. made, finds probable cause & binds Deft over for Trial.  Information filed.
Proceed to pleas. 
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
Parties make joint recommendation.

State moves 15CF197 Ct 1 (Possess Meth) - D&RI; 15CF457 Ct 2 (Possess Controll Substance) - D&RI; Ct 4 (BJ-Misd) - D&RI; 15CM677 Ct 1 (Theft) - D&RI; 16CF186 Ct 3 (BJ-Felony-Repeater) - D&RI; 16CF489 Ct 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater) - D&RI; Ct 2 (Theft-Repeater) - D&RI; 16CF941 Ct 1 through Ct 4  - Dismiss Outright; 17CF1044 Cts 1 - 6 - D&RI; 17CF1066 Cts 2 through 7 - D&RI; 18CF1174 Cts 3 through 8 - D&RI;  18CM2096 Ct 1 (OAR) - D&RI; 17TR4446 Ct 1 (Refuse to take test) - Deemed Lawful and Dismiss Outright -- Court Grants All.  

PLEA: 15CF197 Ct 2 (Possess Narcotic) - No Contest; 15CF457 Ct 1 (BJ-Felony) - No Contest; Ct 3 (Receiving Concealing Stolen Property) - No Contest; 16CF186 Ct 1 (Forgery-Repeater/PTAC) - No Contest; Ct 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater) - No Contest; 17CF1066 Ct 1 (Operate w/restricted controlled substance 7th) - No Contest; 18CF1174 Ct 1 (BJ-Felony) - No Contest; Ct 2 (BJ-Felony) - No Contest; Ct 9 (Possess Drug Parapher) - No Contest.  

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  
Atty Kaupie makes statement; Deft makes statement;

COURT ORDERS: 17CF1066 - Ct 1 -- 8 Years Wisconsin Prison (4 In and 4 ES) - 3 Yrs DL revocation w/credit for admin suspension; 3 Yrs IID; Terms of ES: AODA and follow-up; any other treatment/counseling deemed appropriate by agent; full-time work/school or combinbation or complete 9 hrs of community service each week not so engaged; absolute sobriety; 6 pts; CC; DNA Sample + Surcharge; Eligible for ERP and SAP.  When out on ES she may work community service to pay toward court costs.

COURT ORDERS: 16CF186  Ct 1 - 7 Years Prison (4 In and 3 ES) and Ct 2 - 7 Years Prison (4 In and 3 ES) both IMPOSED &STAYED - Placed on 6 Years Probation.
COURT ORDERS: 15CF197 3 yrs and 6 mo Prison (18 mo In, 2 yrs ES) IMPOSED & STAYED -- Placed on 6 years probation; 
COURT ORDERS: 15CF457 Ct 1 - 6 yrs Prison (3 in and 3 yrs ES) IMPOSED & STAYED - Placed on 6 yrs probation; Ct 3 - 9 months jail.  
COURT ORDERS: 18CF1174 Ct 1 and 2 - 6 yrs Prison on each (3 in and 3 ES) IMPOSED & STAYED - Placed on 6 yrs probation; Ct 9 - 30 Days Jail.  
ALL ABOVE ARE concurrent to each other and Consecutive to 17CF1066;
CONDITIONS OF ES: Assessment/treatment/counseling as receommended; full time work/school or combination; Absolute sobriety; AODA; CC; DNA; DNA surcharge.

Credit issues will be provided to court via stipulation in December.
TIS Provided; DNA Submission Form Signed; Voter Ineligibility Signed.
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief filed.
